title: Current density - current from radius-dependent J

content.question: The current density in a cylindrical conductor of radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> varies with radial position <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> according to <math alttext="J of lowercase r equals, J sub 0, end subscript, times, open parenthesis, 1 minus, open parenthesis, the fraction lowercase r over uppercase R, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>r</mi><mi>R</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. Which expression is equal to the current in the conductor?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi J sub 0, end subscript, times uppercase R squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi J sub 0, end subscript, times uppercase R squared, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi J sub 0, end subscript, times uppercase R squared, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi J sub 0, end subscript, times uppercase R cubed, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi J sub 0, end subscript, times uppercase R squared, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
